benchmark_details.name: OlympiadBench
benchmark_details.overview: OlympiadBench is an Olympiad-level bilingual multimodal scientific benchmark, featuring 8,476 problems from Olympiad-level mathematics and physics competitions, designed to assess the capabilities of large models in mathematical and physical reasoning.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the capabilities of large models in mathematical and physical reasoning with a challenging benchmark.

data.source: Problems sourced from International Olympiads, Chinese Olympiads, and the Chinese College Entrance Exam (GaoKao).
data.annotation: Expert-level annotations for step-by-step reasoning and problem type categorization.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy based on percentage of correctly answered questions.
methodology.interpretation: Lower scores indicate a greater challenge posed by the benchmark to models.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing model, GPT-4V, achieved an average score of 17.97% on OlympiadBench.
methodology.validation: Cross-validation with expert evaluations and automated scoring methods.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data derived should not have identifiable information due to use of official competition sources.
